Name: Balzers
Description: Balzers is a small town located in the southern part of Liechtenstein, known for its medieval castle, the Balzers Castle, and scenic views of the Alps.

Name: Eschen
Description: Eschen is a municipality located in the western part of Liechtenstein, known for its residential areas, schools, and proximity to the Swiss border.

Name: Gamprin
Description: Gamprin is a region in Liechtenstein with a mix of residential and agricultural land. It is known for its peaceful, rural setting and small community feel.

Name: Mauren
Description: Mauren is a town located in the northern part of Liechtenstein, known for its proximity to the capital and scenic landscape, with a growing population.

Name: Schaan
Description: Schaan is the largest municipality and the economic hub of Liechtenstein, housing many of the country s businesses and industries. It is also the location of the Liechtenstein National Library.

Name: Schellenberg
Description: Schellenberg is a small village located in the central region of Liechtenstein, known for its charming atmosphere and historical landmarks.

Name: Vaduz
Description: Vaduz is the capital city of Liechtenstein, known for its modern architecture, the Liechtenstein Castle, and its role as the political and cultural center of the country.

Name: Balzers and surrounding
Description: The region around Balzers offers picturesque views of the Alps and is home to several important historical sites, including the medieval Balzers Castle.
